quotes.message: When you close your eyes to tragedy, you close your eyes to greatness.
quotes.name: Stephen Vizinczey

quotes.message: The tragedy of this world is that everyone is alone. For a life in the past cannot be shared with the present.
quotes.name: Alan Lightman

quotes.message: In this world there are two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it. The last is much the worst.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: Life is a comedy to those who think, a tragedy to those who feel.
quotes.name: Jean Racine

quotes.message: A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.
quotes.name: Joseph Stalin

quotes.message: A tragedy is the imitation of an action that is serious and also, as having magnitude, complete in itself with incidents arousing pity and fear, wherewith to accomplish its catharsis of such emotions.
quotes.name: Aristotle

quotes.message: Here is the tragedy: when you are the victim of depression, not only do you feel utterly helpless and abandoned by the world, you also know that very few people can understand, or even begin to believe, that life can be this painful.
quotes.name: Giles Andreae

quotes.message: The tragedy about history - personally and globally is that while we may learn it we rarely learn from it.
quotes.name: Rasheed Ogunlaru

quotes.message: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
quotes.name: Sholom Aleichem

quotes.message: Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.
quotes.name: Robert F. Kennedy

quotes.message: You use everything. You use tragedy you use everything.
quotes.name: Shannon Hoon

quotes.message: There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it.
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: Life's tragedy is that we get old too soon and wise too late.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: Tragedy is like strong acid it dissolves away all but the very gold of truth.
quotes.name: D. H. Lawrence

quotes.message: The greatest tragedy in mankind's entire history may be the hijacking of morality by religion.
quotes.name: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.message: One of the greatest tragedies in life is to lose your own sense of self and accept the version of you that is expected by everyone else.
quotes.name: K.L. Toth

quotes.message: The tragedy of this world is that no one is happy, whether stuck in a time of pain or of joy. The tragedy of this world is that everyone is alone. For a life in the past cannot be shared with the present. Each person who gets stuck in time gets stuck alone.
quotes.name: Alan Lightman

quotes.message: Tragedy, for me, is not a conflict between right and wrong, but between two different kinds of right.
quotes.name: Peter Shaffer

quotes.message: The tragedy of this world is that no one is happy, whether stuck in a time of pain or joy.
quotes.name: Alan Lightman

quotes.message: There is nothing more tragic than to find an individual bogged down in the length of life, devoid of breadth.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.message: It's not the tragedies that kill us, it's the messes.
quotes.name: Dorothy Parker

quotes.message: Tragedy is a representation of action that is worthy of serious attention, complete in itself and of some magnitude bringing about by means of pity and fear the purging of such emotions.
quotes.name: Aristotle

quotes.message: This world is a comedy to those that think, a tragedy to those that feel.
quotes.name: Horace Walpole

quotes.message: A great tragedy is occurring. Millions of people are dying prematurely. These people are killing themselves and they don't even know it.
quotes.name: Tim Loy

quotes.message: Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die.
quotes.name: Mel Brooks

quotes.message: The tragedy is not that love doesn't last. The tragedy is the love that lasts.
quotes.name: Shirley Hazzard

quotes.message: You get tragedy where the tree, instead of bending, breaks.
quotes.name: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.message: A tragedy need not have blood and death; it's enough that it all be filled with that majestic sadness that is the pleasure of tragedy.
quotes.name: Jean Racine

quotes.message: Tragedy makes you grow up.
quotes.name: Jane Campion

quotes.message: The tragedy of life is not that man loses, but that he almost wins.
quotes.name: Heywood Broun

quotes.message: Only a great mind that is overthrown yields tragedy.
quotes.name: Jacques Barzun

quotes.message: A perfect tragedy is the noblest production of human nature.
quotes.name: Joseph Addison

quotes.message: The tragedy of life is what dies inside a man while he lives.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein
